reviewText: Hands down, this game has the best fighting system of all mmos. One of the problems that i have with other fighter mmos is that the combat are too slow. In this game however, it's fast just like how a fighting game should be, fast and intense. The dungeon can get boring after a while but the pvp is where this game shines. It is where you put what you have learn to use against other people, but I don't recommend you start pvping till you're level 35.\n\n2015 Update: There are now some balancing issues. Some characters/classes are just outright overpowered the other classes(Crimson Avenger/Diabolic Esper). Thankfully there is a patch coming that will be nerfing them.

reviewText:
This game is hands down one of the great MMOs. I would highly reccommend it for its class stability and its dedication to its players. It never fails to be a good game in my book and I hope that they continue to bring such great content as they always have.

Pros:

reviewText:
I love this game! Its style is totally what I am into a heck lot. Though it may not work for everyone's liking.
In terms of gameplay it can be rather fun and different from other games you may play.

Characters:
In this game all play differently, each and every individual character and class has its distinct features and all tend to accelerate in different ways.The characters all have very diverse skills and playstyles, surely it will make you feel like you're playing a manga/comic.
Aside from the main topic, if you play in-game many people may complain (that's an NA server for you), however, each character has it's proper work around to getting through each task
(including PvP which most people get salty at lol).
I do have my fair share of getting frustrated, though after all it might just mean you may have been outplayed.
(But this is a F2P game LOL, so expect overgeared players too... [Totally worth getting mad for sometimes])

Dungeons:
I have to say the dungeons in Elsword are also rather diverse xD!
The scenery of each place tends to have a different feel.
Oh, and not to mention!... There is also a dungeon to run through all the bosses, IT IS NOT A CAKEWALK AT ALL.

Arena:
The arena (PVP) in this game is hilariously fun.

1v1 being the most skillful played in. Doing 1v1 truly shows how skillful you are (Or how much you can spam x_x... that can be useful I guess?... Not entirely a good thing to see.)

2v2 being the most competitive. While doing 2v2s brings on teamwork, making tactics important to play with.

3v3 being the most fun and chaotic xD! The amount of spammage is hilarious and you may not even be able to know what is going on, it's great, yet annoying. If you're too serious then it may not be as fun as it seems.(This may stand for everything in-game though, but it's best to have fun in PvP than get frustrated.)

reviewText:
An interesting MMO. Sure there are other side-scrolling multiplayer games, like Awesomenauts, but that focuses more on team versus matches. With Elsword you have quality visuals, done in an anime-esque cell shading style, character voices are done in Japanesse (text is in English). What's different here is that the vast majority of the time, you don't need your mouse. All combat is controlled from the keyboard, from movement to attacks and the mouse only seems to be used for menus. Also, this game uses a Stamina system; killing monsters in dungeons uses stamina, the more players running that dungeon, the less you use. Stamina refills daily (3am PST), but is unlimited on weekends, and honestly, you can get at least 3-4 hours of dungeon time in on your daily stamina, so it's not a huge deal.

What can be a bit confusing are the costume pieces from the real-money store. While they're nice and they can make your character look decent, they all seem to be limited-time use items. I may be wrong about that, but when you look at them the price is listed twice, one for a 30-day use and one permanent for 2x the 30-day price. You can get by without them, as they only apply stat boost on top of whatever your getting from armor/weapons/ect.

That aside, the game is highly addictive. However, for most quest you seem to have to repeat dungeons over at least 2-3 times, often at specific difficulty levels or higher, but said dungeons have 3 difficulty levels and you can always just join a random group to take on the highest levels or run solo if you're feeling up to it. Dungeons are also split up, with some not letting you progress till all enemies are dead. One gripe I found was in the Skill Notebook quest where I had to run two dungeons over and over again in order to kill one enemy type because I need to collect 20 items, which were rare drops (I'd get 2-3 per run, max with some runs giving none). But most times you're asked to collect 20+ of an item you get it from every avaliable enemy kill, so it's only a problem in specific quests where the item is listed as Rare.

In-game currency is easy to come by. At only 6 hours in I'd already accumulated over 300k, and probably spent even more upgrading my equipment as well, since you can get a lot of use out of equipment via enchanting, enhancing and repairing before you need to get something new.

I haven't delved too deeply into crafting, but item/weapon enhancement is done two different ways, each adding diffrent things, so the system there is robust enough to allow for customization to play prefferences.

In all it's a solid game with solid mechanics, detailed characters, both NPC and your own. My only real gripe is that unless you pay K-Ching (the games real-world money) you're limited to only 3 item quick-slots and 4 skill quick-slots, you're inventory is also limited, with 8 slot upgrades costing 200 K-Ching. However, 1 K-Ching is ~$.01, so it's not that big a cost (This is based off the 500 K-Ching pack costing $5US). But be warned that such upgrades are bought on a per character basis, so it costs about $14 per character to get +16 inventory spaces and all 8 skill quick slots, but you can play just as well with the stock free setup.

reviewText:
TL;DR
If you want to play the beginning and have fun, sure, go ahead. It'll be lots of fun. However as you progress, many issues become glaringly obvious and makes the game less fun.

While this game is quite fun, it easily begins to lose its charm over time. In the beginning, it's all pretty fun, leveling and learning about skills and everything. But there are so many small things that form into a big issue. The amount of grinding is way too much. Yes, I expected grinding from a MMORPG, but this is too much. For a class advancement, expect to give out a little money or run three to five dungeons over and over and over on the premise of a rare drop. Want to be able to use more than 4 skills at once? Pay up for 4 more slots! Want to be able to use more options? Pay for more slots. Inventory? Pay up. There's no way to get them without paying unless you wait and wait hoping for an event that allows you to earn them. PvE is easily repetitive and uninteresting after a while, and PvP is broken. If you run a dungeon, you'll likely have one player riding a paid mount and kills almost everything before you can get to it. PvP? Not including the amount of laggers you can find, but to even stand a chance most of the time you need to pay money. See a cool looking costume that also gives stats? $30. Per costume. And all costumes have a cheaper price, but they're only temporary. Many PvP items that hold an advantage are either temporary, or you have to pay for them. It's quite ridiculous how much they want you to pay, and that's not even all. Not only that, but the older characters are usually useless compared to the newer characters. You wanted to play Elsword, the main character? Well too bad, you're going to have to try harder because you likely picked a weak character compared to, say, Add or Lu/Ciel. I tried to like this game, I made some good friends on it, but it doesn't seem worth it. I honestly can't recommend this game unless you want to just jump on for a few times and try it.

reviewText: Hands down, this game has the best fighting system of all mmos. One of the problems that i have with other fighter mmos is that the combat are too slow. In this game however, it's fast just like how a fighting game should be, fast and intense. The dungeon can get boring after a while but the pvp is where this game shines. It is where you put what you have learn to use against other people, but I don't recommend you start pvping till you're level 35.\n\n2015 Update: There are now some balancing issues. Some characters/classes are just outright overpowered the other classes(Crimson Avenger/Diabolic Esper). Thankfully there is a patch coming that will be nerfing them.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Ah Elsword, I gotta say, this is one of the best Anime MMORPGs I've played in my experience as a gamer.
Don't throw your F grenades yet, (and by F i mean F@%*) I do know about LOL, Diablo, WOW, and destiny, so hear me out and take your fingers out of the pin hole.

Now I don't know about you guys, but when I'm about to jump into a new MMO, I tend to do research.
I start with the little things, is it visually appealing? Does it have PVP and if it does is it well ballanced? Can I see my character fully instead of just the top of it's head? and most important, is it fun?
In my opinion Elsword has everything an MMO should, awesome fast paced gameplay, unique character styles and combat, beautiful scenery, and blood pumping PvP action. And this for free!
Dispite the gender locked characters that all start out the same, you are somehow able to still feel unique and different from any other player. Be it cosmetically or combat wise. You don't ahve to spend DAYS!!! trying to level up just to get past a stage. And admittedly, the dungeons can and will get kinda repetitive, this happenes in all gaming, the only way to avoid it is to keep coming out with new missions and updates. Which, as far as I know, Elsword does.

Remember what I said about balanced PvP? Well this isn't exactly the best example. While it may seem impossible for a level 4 to absolutely destroy a level 70, I gotta say in Elsword, this isn't all that uncommon. What I like about ES's PvP is that it gives all players a chance, if they are skilled. What I don't like is that the new characters are automatically stronger and more efficient, which, outside of context makes perfect sence right? New meaning improved and more efficient. But honestly, its like you don't even need skill anymore, I normally play as the star character Elsword himself, but I tried one day as a new character named Ara. at level 10 I effortlessly conquered a level 64. and don't get me wrong, this was an A class player, he had experience! but Ara is absolutely unstoppable and has seemingly endless combos, thats absurd to me. But like I said, if you are more skilled than the other you will win.
All in All, Elsword is a great game to play if you have patience and are a wiz at combos. I'd always recomend it to anyone who calls themself a gamer.                                                                   Gameplay: 9/10
Story: 7/10
PvP: 8/10
Visuals: 9.5/10
Community: 9/10

reviewText: Pretty Straight forward. Move to either the left or the right (depending on where the game wants you to go) and kill everything in your way. With 8 characters each with multiple job changes for each to keep combat exciting with more skills added to the skill tree. As the game progresses the dungeons get harder, monsters get stronger and the importance of a team is almost required by level 40+. As a person that has used all of the classes, I can firmly say that each has it's advantages and drawbacks, some more than others of course, but that does with any game. This is not your typical MMO with healer, tank, and DPS. Each character is equally capable of dishing out death and destruction across the 2-d dungeons.

reviewText:
Don't get me wrong this game is fun to play and the style of the characters, levels, enemies and weapons are interesting however.

Due to certain reasons i'm unable to actually launch the game since the game forced me into having it into windows however that can be due to my own end.

Also to my own opinion theres to much information and text going on around the screeen for you to enjoy and due to that reason the text it self is also kind of small so for people with damaged eyesight like me will have trouble same with people who have problems when it comes to keeping up with things that popping up within a few seconds, also people with epilepsy (sorry if i spelled it wrong i'm very dumb) should not play due to that certain attacks have bright flashes and such.

Plus if you want to play with friends in different countries/regions then you cant becuase of the fact that the severs you play on are based on where you region is so that option is directly ou the region and to be honset I am not sure if there is but personaly I belive that there should be a hide other layers option because there are a lot of players so it can get confusing at times.

In the end I say if you are sure your computer/laptop/mac can support it and you dont mind confusing text and random stuff then your should try this game however if your more for the simplistic and fun type of games then you should think about downloading this game and probably not download it and try to find another game.

reviewText:
The good-
~ Fast-paced gameplay.
~ Skill and Class variety.
~ PvP.
~ PvE.
~ Character customization through outfits and accessories.

The bad-
~ Gender-locked classes.
~ Certain skills are locked until a tedious quest is completed to unlock them.
~ Character balance is thrown off with each new class or character addition.
~ Exploiting a certain stat (Add/Red Dmg) can break the characters in PvP and make them ridiculously OP".
~ Most outfits used to customize your character can only be obtained via the Item Mall
hoursPlayed: true

reviewText:
I must say, I've played this game for quite some time and it's stuck with me. If you love manga/anime and you're looking for a great online RPG to get addicted to and emersed in, this is the game for you. A one-of-a-kind hack and slash fast-paced side scroller.

Pros:
- Excellent customisablity of gameplay
- EXCELLENT COSMETICS (reason enough for an anime/manga fan to play)
- Fun and enjoyable graphics/themes
- Highly addictive playstyle
- Flexible combos

Cons:
- Hard exp table
->> You're going to really feel the grind with this one
- Cashing has huge advantages (+50% exp medals, BSlots, Mana necklaces to name a few)
- Hugely inflated player economy
->> It's going to be hard to get anything near luxury-tier if you start out and don't plan to cash
- Server locks (You're usually not able to play cross-continent, which isn't great if you have overseas friends)
- Genderlocked classes (if you want to shoot arrows, magic or play with drones you have to be female, if you want to wield a sword or cannon you have to be male...)
- Stamina system (restricts how much you can play per day)

Overall, I'm well aware that this game has it's downfalls, but again if you're an anime or manga fan with a love for online RPGs, then I wouldn't hesitate to reccommend this.

Feel free to chat to me in game if you feel like it. ;D

IGN: Primacy

reviewText:
The game its just addictive , it have some Positive and Negatives things.
At least the game is just a perfect example of side screen game.
Positive
-Various Characters as (Elsword, Raven, Rena, Eve, Aisha, Ara, Lu/Ciel, Add, Elesis)
-Different Class For Every Character ( Every character have 3 different jobs)
-Lot of Dungeons to play
-Featured Level 75 ( In Other update 80)
-PVP Is fun
-Sparring (PvP Training) , Make you wast a lot of time with friend playing or chat.
-A lot of Nice costumes, suits,etc for every character
-Nice Visual Effects
-You can get All of pay for win items or costumes by the money of the game (ED)

Negative
-Took too much time to level up (From level 50+)
-All Cool stuff its really expensive with ED(Money of the game), and on Real money
-The Costumes are expensive for real money
-A little bit of salty people
-If you pay you win more easy
-You probly dont want to know the price of the items on ED
-Take too much time to get an amount of ED for buy something cool
-Lag when a new thing is up
-Events are a little poor but w/e FREE STUFF!

The game probly can have more points but the economy on the game to get a nice Costume is a ****, so thats why.

7/10

reviewText:
A really good MMORPG and an unique one that I have never played before.

Pros:

-Each of the characters in the game have a great background story, which will help you be attached to your character and keeping you interested into the game.
-An unique gameplay that differs from other MMORPGs.
-You can create powerful combos with your skills and attacks.
-The animation are really well done and smooth.
-Cute characters ~

Neutral:

-The community is quite respectful, but you know that is not the case everytime (ragers in PVP <.<)

Cons:

-The leveling up system will start to annoy you from level 50 or 55 (unless you like to repeat the same dungeon over and over '-').
-After you complete a quest that took you a long time to level up, you must level up again to unlock the next quest.
-You may encountered hackers in the PVE and PVP mode (I don't know if they use a greate hackshield to prevent that because I didn't catch up with the latest update recently).
-The gameplay can get quite repetitive, like I said in the first con.¸

Overall, it is a great MMORPG and you should definitely give it a try before judging it. I may miss some points, but I think it is the popular ones that pop out easily. Anime lovers would love this game and if you don't, then it's okay x)

reviewText:
Elsword is a 2.5d side scrolling dressi----... i mean action MMO, which is similar to MapleStory, but with a more fast-paced and closer to a 3d gameplay elements.

Pros:
-Competetive pvp and pve element, is naturally inbalanced, the dungeon scoreboard and going into pvp will tells you EVERYTHING in 1 day for which character is unavoidably the best from sight.

-Dungeon loot from grinds degrade to become shiettier when you keep repeating it.

-skill effect graphics will blind your whole screen, most would drop your fps to 1, yes, just by the push of 1 keyboard button, you control all other 7 players around you by dropping their fps and making them tripping balls.

-Perfect english Voice Acting, just perfect...

-when 1 player lags amongts the other 7 player, all the 7 player's skill casted would not be seen by that lagger, and when that happens, no damage is dealt to anything, which makes your progress STUCK for hours before the lagger disappears.

-Interactive events, that helps in many ways, even in spending real money.

Cons:
-you'll see foreign guilds and players that prefer to stay in the old zone despite when theres an international server available w/e bad reputation
-fps drops for certain console users at specific patches, certain specific wat?
-Balance does not always exists
-Grind
-toxic community (if you do find people being nice to you, they're lonely and want to waste your time)
-combo? escaped with lag or opening interface.
-not so Pay2win character upgrades, skill slot, consumeable slot, inventory spaces, special pets and mounts
-pay2win gear enhancement
-real money costumes give stats, well okay this and the above can still be obtained through events but the effort compared to pve elements stretches more than most could reach for a desirable outcome(refer to Pros)
-you'll rank up even when you lose, which the game system will then match you up with stronger opponent to increase the salt level in your heart, and you realize that you've only won 1 match after 2 hours, until you reach a certain rank progression, you'll keep losing, and losing, and losing, as you stop ranking up at that point because you can't win any further, theres your limit, the game is now telling you to get good.
-this may be your [where most player quit because of it] part, *Bandwagon* is a thing, you get update for OP stuff such as new character or rewarding bonus dungeon events, EVERYONE GOES FOR IT, YOU HAVE TO EMBRACE THE PLAYER TRAFFIC, else you can't win, all the obvious winning stuff is there, all foreign future patches are revealed, catches? not all the respective country patch are the same, well guess what, most relevant OP stuff still are. Get on the bandwagon today to catch up on one of the mainstream Overpowered items that the game could reward players to! Cause Mainstream. Good news, hibernating players who haven't play in months now congest the server happily, cheers, to a great human traffic event/updates.
-wanna do events with rich rewards and giveaways? guess what, they get taken by alternate charaters. If you only main 1 character and never play anyone else, you lose alot, the game just wants more of your time. Heck your prizes you gave might even end up given away to the same players that uses 2 different username.
-at most times, when interact with old players, they open no chance for new players to introduce theirselves into any group interested in, even if the new players do get in, we get forgery no matter how our approach goes, it is absolutely way better to stick in a group of new players together instead.

Single player perspective: Elsword will be your last MMO you've ever play in your whole life. No matter what you'd do, being the top, being the worst, being invisible, no1 would care in the end. Just play it as a single player, you don't need pvp/guild/people to talk to, its worthless itself.

Multiplayer perspective: Elsword will be an MMO that you CAN NEVER FORGET and would definitely introduce you to many socialable friends of many type that are better than IRL.

Limits beyond measure dear adventurer... Limits, beyond, measure.

18/18 to El peeps who plays because of rena and ara.

Greetings,

I like this game and especially the fact the graphics looks really nice... but the issue with this game is the lack of structural support.

I have gone through the game options to adjust the graphics settings and every time I clicked apply... it just freezes the program. My graphics card is pretty powerful and there should be no reason this game would not freeze on a higher graphics scale.

Second of all, when I tried installing this game again since I have system restored my computer since I thought I had an issue with my graphics card (but it appeared i did not had any problems with my graphics card at all).

Overrall, I am not happy of this games client stability nor being able to download the game.

reviewText:
This is a pretty good game for an anime RPG, It's has a colourful design, lovable characters and it's overall fun. sometimes your inventory slots can be full the more you progress through the game and you would need to pay 'Ka-Ching' (the online currency in the game) to unlock more spaces. But thats not the main use of Ka-Ching though, you can buy costumes and stuff to make your character unique, and you don't just have 1, you can have up to 3 or more slots by default and you can expand the number of slots depending if you are willing to pay a tiny amount of money to gain an extra character slot. (which I did, because I wanted to try out all the characters)
Quests can sometimes be repetitive, but if you have friends or party members to do dungeons with you, then it should be a walk in the park. It's not hard to play, the turtorial is very clear and the quests are simple, so there is nothing to worry to get used to playing this game.
I really do enjoy this game overall, the only flaw it has that it limits you for inventory slots which can sometimes be annoying since you have to sell some stuff to get more room, I'm not too bothered since the stuff I sell are low level items.
But don't be discouraged to play this game, it is free-to-play game after all and you can play through the game happily without spending a single penny like I did.

reviewText:
The game overall is not extremely hard and doesnt require too much grinding, but what turned me off is how it requires you to pay for a crapload of extras. Extra item slots, extra skill slots, the coupling mechanic, costumes, etc. This game can be played without spending a dime, but asks you BUY THIS TO UNLOCK THAT everywhere.

The environment design is also a bit of a clusterf&ck and can give you eyestrain. Bright color palette and busy advertisments littered everywhere TO BUY THIS NEW PACK, coupled with 20 players bouncing around on screen makes it overall visually chaotic.

Perhaps most insulting thing in this game is how it dangles cool features to new comers that have expiration dates on them. I picked Elesis because of her cute battle dress design only to come back a week later to realize it had been stripped away because of the expiration date. OF COURSE I could reaquire it by SPENDING MONEY. Yet, there is a way to aquire currency without spending money by TAKING SURVEYS! Even the legit" free surveys sponsored by the developers is like throwing time and effort down a rathole
date: so much that you'll want to spend money to spite them. But I digress. In short
recommended: like pretty much all free to play games
hoursPlayed: Elsword has many ways to try and get one's money
voteText:
but money isnt really necessary to play and enjoy it.

The story is almost negligible. Some sprites pop up and talk about some bandits in a forest or some dragon in a cave.. meh I didnt care. It does not present the story in an interesting way at all. No cinematics. No incenstive to care at all about any kind of narrative.

But the positive I can is that it is 2D and fairly simple to progress and level up. The community is pretty friendly too. Once you gain your skills and a strong enough weapon
helpfulPercent: it can get addictive. Also the music is quite catchy. Found myself humming it for a while. The quality of the music feels somewhat un matching to the quality of the game.\n\nMy verdict: Its casual enough to pick and waste some time in if you like being a cute chibi character
votesHelpful: but if you are looking for some intense gameplay or interesting strats
votesTotal: just move on to something else."

reviewText: So I will try to not sugarcoat it - Like many games from Nexon Korea, this game require sooo much cash to play if you want to win at stuff like pvp and everything.. The costumes usually come in sets, which allow you to gain additional stats with more pieces of the outfit.. However, not all of the pieces might be appealing on your chosen character so you will probably end up mix and matching outfits to make your character more appealing.. I mean you you are trying to prettify your character to make it unique as compared to all of the other similar characters. But if looks don't matter go ahead and spend the money.. Unlike other Nexon Korea game, say maplestory, every equippable item has the option to buy permanent costume pieces, much in the way that Vindictus (Mabinogi Heroes) does, with the expirable version costing less based on duration.

reviewText:
Elsword is sort of like a 3D Maple Story in it's own way. So if you enjoyed that, you might like this.

From the begining it can get qutie repititve really fast. It's not like most MMOs where you have an abundance of quests to do, rather, you only get a few quests per level. This can get pretty frustrating past level 40, as it forces you to either dungeon grind or field grind (Fields are areas with monsters that you can do repeat quests over and over. It's very stamina efficenet on weekdays, and gives a fair amount of xp.) Ereda Island is also a nice alternative if you're looking for PVE mixed with PVP. It's stamina efficent and it gives good exp.

This game does have a stamina system. When you run out of stamina, you can no longer dungeon or gain exp from monsters in field. While most would be turned off by this, I personally don't find myself ever running out of stamina. This might be because I enjoy playing plenty of characters though, so I switch often. On weekends, stamina is unlimited.

I can't really think of many things that are bad about Elsword, persay. Some would call it pay2win, due to the only way you can aquire costumes and such is through the cash shop. Plenty of players are able to play with no trouble and never spend a dime on the game. I have personally cashed, but I do remember what it was like not to cash as well. Not being able to cash limits some things, but I wouldn't say by much. You could also buy KC (The cash shop currency) from other players, but our economy is quite terrible right now so that may not be an option. Whether you cash or not does not limit your ability though, and those who think like that are silly.

I think PVP is the one reason why I think this game is great. The combo system and how everything works together is very interesting. Unfortunately, many people are quite rude in PVP and those who are considered the top players have a large ego. Prepare for the salt if you decide to PVP. (I do not recommend PVPing before at LEAST 45 if you decide to, due to level differences. If you choose to PVP before then is at your own risk.)

http://elwiki.net/ is a great place for game information if you're looking to have questions answered. You can always try the game's forums as well. People are usually kind there, just be careful on how you word things.

reviewText:
I recommend this game for several reasons.

1) If you love to do combos in games you can figure out what combos are good for you.
2) Also if you just want to play with friends and just play together you can dungeons in regions.
3) If your a competive person you can do PVPs and use combos that are best for you.
4) If you just want to play want to train with friends you can set up a lobby and just train with your friends in sparring.
5) You also can create guilds and earn guild points to level up your guild and make your guild stronger.
6) There are different characters you can choose from and each character has there own job class you can choose from. There are 3 job class you can choose for each character (Not including Ara Haan) and those job class enhances your abilities.
7) Also there are events you can do and they can get you new equipment and help enhance some of your skills in your skill tree.

reviewText:
This game. Haha, I've put in so many hours... So much money, and I keep telling myself I don't have to, and yet I still do. You don't have to pay money, but it is worth it in the end becaue well... IN A WAY, it's one of those pay to win type of games.

Pros:

Access to ALL characters
Each character has something special about them, I LOVE the variety of skills with the different classes as well.
FUN, You don't get bored.
Cons:

When they give you a free lvl up to 35 for a certain character during special events, people using the new character will RAID pvp and it gets a little annoying.
You have to pay a lot to keep certain items from the item mall for 30 days, so if you're going to buy an outfit or a boost, just buy the items permanent.
Repeating a certain dungeon more than 6x can be a little annoying. (To complete certain quests)

reviewText: I played this game since it first came out. I tried to love this game, but I couldn't. I came back to it recently and the game has changed a lot since the last updates. The skill points have been removed, making skills much more balanced and easier to manage, dungeons have been made shorter and easier, allied npcs have been added to replace missing players in dungeons, most of what prevented me to enjoy this game has been fixed. The only thing left that I hate is that it's still a bit pay to win with slow leveling up and overpriced items.

reviewText:
Elsword is an amazing game to play with friends and family, game is pretty fast paced and has a more in depth combo system than it may seem with two basic attack keys and 4 or so active skill keys. But I do not reccomend this version... while it may say I've been playing the game for 53 hours, I should note I first started playing Elsword as far back as Closed Beta for NA.

The problem with this version of Elsword is being it has slowly creeped from something you didn't need to cash to play, into something where it seems your credit card is becoming more and more of a vital tool to keep up, speccialy if you wish to remotely even buy anything in the market that's been inflated to a point any in-game ED(Gold) you get will only really be spent on NPC services.

The host as well hasn't proved shy of converting free features into cash features. Skill Notes for example have been converted into a mostly cash feature, they improve skills you can learn in some way or another. But unelss you wish to get a skill note for a lousy active skill nobody chooses for very good reasons. Due to how the skill trees work in this game, you often won't even pick up the worse skill in a choice since picking Skill X will lock Skill Y entirely, making many if not all quest earned skill notes left unused. (If you plan to play the Korea version, this point is null as skill notes are a mob drop over there.)

And then going back onto the economy... an in-game gamble box will give cash players many of what they'll need.. and more. So don't expect to be able to sell your rarer drops to them except for Secret Dungeon drops. This is because the gamble box gives them much more of the same items you can find in-game form mob drops... without the grind. This has resulted in an in-game economy where only cashers can trade with cashers and very few if any F2Ps can actually buy anything of note worth, the aforementioend skill notes bought with KC can be traded after being bought... but the ED to KC rate will make it far too much ingame gold for one out of 6 skill note slots..

While I do enjoy the game itself as well... a game mechanics wise and as a fun arcadey co-op beat em' up, I have to advise players to stay away from Elsword NA. Look into other servers instead, I'ms ure if you google a bit you can discover many other servers of which may be a far superior alternative.

reviewText:
A very fun game, i prefer to use the game launcher from the website but you can go either way.

This game has pros and cons but is very enjoyable if you dont mind doing the same dungeon 3-4 times over and over again as it does indeed get old But lets get on to the pros and cons.

Pros:
-Very enjoyable for something in your off time.
-PvE is enjoyable.
-A nice leveling scale as it gets pretty difficult for 60-85 (I found it quite difficult)
-Nice idea of job changes for each character which supplies a character with new combos and skills making it a very refreshing game if you like to do the main story over again just to try out each characters job change (each job change has a 2nd version which makes it gain more skills and combos).
-Manages to pull off a good anime style type of game.
-Side scrolling beat em up MMoRPG thats enjoyable.

Cons:
-PvP is Unbalanced (Basically PTW).
-Repetitive.
-New classes tend to be more powerfull then the old ones.
-Can get insanely boring later on in the higher levels trying to get to 85.

And thats pretty much it, there isnt really anything else about this game other than its enjoyable for awhile but gets boring near the middle of the game and the pvp is pretty unbalanced most of the times, but its a must play if you enjoy playing through dungeons over and over again or like making people salty in pvp (Beause NA is salty AF).

reviewText:
Elsword is sort of like a 3D Maple Story in it's own way. So if you enjoyed that, you might like this.

From the begining it can get qutie repititve really fast. It's not like most MMOs where you have an abundance of quests to do, rather, you only get a few quests per level. This can get pretty frustrating past level 40, as it forces you to either dungeon grind or field grind (Fields are areas with monsters that you can do repeat quests over and over. It's very stamina efficenet on weekdays, and gives a fair amount of xp.) Ereda Island is also a nice alternative if you're looking for PVE mixed with PVP. It's stamina efficent and it gives good exp.

This game does have a stamina system. When you run out of stamina, you can no longer dungeon or gain exp from monsters in field. While most would be turned off by this, I personally don't find myself ever running out of stamina. This might be because I enjoy playing plenty of characters though, so I switch often. On weekends, stamina is unlimited.

I can't really think of many things that are bad about Elsword, persay. Some would call it pay2win, due to the only way you can aquire costumes and such is through the cash shop. Plenty of players are able to play with no trouble and never spend a dime on the game. I have personally cashed, but I do remember what it was like not to cash as well. Not being able to cash limits some things, but I wouldn't say by much. You could also buy KC (The cash shop currency) from other players, but our economy is quite terrible right now so that may not be an option. Whether you cash or not does not limit your ability though, and those who think like that are silly.

I think PVP is the one reason why I think this game is great. The combo system and how everything works together is very interesting. Unfortunately, many people are quite rude in PVP and those who are considered the top players have a large ego. Prepare for the salt if you decide to PVP. (I do not recommend PVPing before at LEAST 45 if you decide to, due to level differences. If you choose to PVP before then is at your own risk.)

http://elwiki.net/ is a great place for game information if you're looking to have questions answered. You can always try the game's forums as well. People are usually kind there, just be careful on how you word things.

reviewText:
Quick SummaryA fun localized MMORPG that consists of pressing Z.

Purchase Verdict: Free and worth trying.

Points of Interest-There is a limit to how much you can play (approximately 4 hours a day) during the week. (Due to deaths of players who marathon games and don't eat, sleep, or go to the bathroom.) This limit is removed during the weekends.

-Plenty of different characters, who progress through various jobs (classes) as you level up.

-Nice art style, and semi-interesting story.

-Not necessarily Pay-to-Win, but more serious players may find themselves at a disadvantage if they don't pay for some things.

-In my experience, community is large, but not many people communicate.

reviewText: Elsword is indeed very repetative with many dungeons and quest that can often cause thge player to have frustraitions while playing the game. That however should be no reason to not try this game. Besides being repetative Elsword has plenty of features in game to make the game more fun and also entertaining. One Feature is character customization. The game has many In-Game shops where you can buy accessories and diffrent types of armor for your character. If thats not not enough the game also has a cash shop where you can buy many kinds of costumes  and items that give you mounts and many peices of gear that helps you make many diffrent character customizations. Another two features is pvp and the skill tree. Elsword has a solid base for pvp that allows you to create your own combinations of combos that can knock your opponent down with lightning ast attks to attking your enemy while their in the air with swift skills or slashes from the characters blade. with many skills and combinations to chose from the pvp has a uniqueness of its own. For players that want to get married in game there is a marriage system. The marriage sytem is broken into 4 steps. first you need to find the person you want your character to marry. afterwards you need to buy the couples ring from the cash shop (The item can only be found in the CashShop alone).once you give the ring to the person you want to marry you must wait 3 days (this time can be used to get to know eachother better ). when the time is up you can buy the marriage pakage which will have a certain number of invatations you can send to your friends and a item for using one of the chappels in the game. The final feature i'm going to be speaking of is the world aspect of the game since with all due respect i don't want to waste any more of peoples time.the world aspect may be that it is a side-scroller game but that doesn't mean it doesn't have anything for you to do. this multiplayer game will have you in a single player instance to start with in the beginning but there is more to it. after that one instance you are sent into the open world. you can meet many people, make friends, even for you people that struggle with the dungeons or quest there is a large community of people to help you get through the game.

reviewText:
Here we are, yet another review on this game. I'm not gonna go so deep into things but I'll make this enough to know what's going on.

Been playing this for 2 years before I joined Steam and it used to be a fun game, but went downhill ever since CBS was released. There's been less and less balance between the characters since then and it's nearing a breaking point. to avoid most of the headache, don't do PvP. You won't be able to get a few items by avoiding it, but it's all mainly for looks anyway.

Dungeons to me are fine at first, but get really tedious after a while because it's the same tactic. Beat the crap out of everything as fast as possible, rinse, repeat. Very few bosses either need a strategy or force you to divert your attention. They have fixed the leveling issue a bit with the new random missions, but it's still a long grind in order to hit the level cap, which needs to be done if you wanna be as powerful as possible.

Speaking of power, this game is free to play, but is so Cash Shop geared that you can put tons of money into it and become nearly unbeatable. There's also players that pride themselves on this stuff, so that's even more fun removed from the game and the reason why no one really does another thing called Ereda Island despite there being less hackers in the game.

What I do like however is very little. I like how the game looks and some of the gameplay, but it's (again) overshadowed by the pay to win crap and lack of balance. The soundtrack isn't bad, but hearing it after a while, you may just mute it and get your own music. Most impressive looking places are the Hunting Fields and trust me, you'll see a lot of them given the grinding issue. I do like how the characters are designed too, along with the various looks you can give them even without putting a single cent into the game.

So, what do I think overall? It's decent if you don't mind the grinding and don't play PvP. But it's gone downhill so much that this is mainly to kill time or play dress-up. You can make friends, but you WILL make enemies too given the community. And in game crap is expensive, but smart players can get around that. All in all, it's a good idea gone bad and I can't really recommend it. Trust me, there's a lot more negative things I can mention about this game that I didn't put in...

reviewText:
You need to play it yourself to see what it's all about, and when something is free, give me one excuse why you shouldn't at least give it a shot.

A great MMO and a great Beat-em' Up merged into one neat title which can be a little heavy on your wallet at times but is still an overall great experience. At the time of writing I've put 100+ hours into 3 characters, and it was mostly worth it. A few frustrations keep this from being a 10/10 game but it's certainly worthy of at least an 8.

Great combat mechanics, fun combos, good anime-style visuals, passable story. lots of variety and lots of fun and laughs. Highly recommend.

reviewText:
This game is great for those who love dungeon crawlers. It's addicting and with Ara's Little Devil released to the NA server, the game just got better. Each character has their own ability and really neat weapon. My all time favorite has to be Chung's Deadly Chaser class. He's great in PvP since he's great for ranged and close-up combat with his cannon, Destroyer.

---

Pros:
-Excellent gameplay!
-Friendly GMs~ (You go, GMs Cuddles and Pebbles!)
-Neat events!
-An Awesome community that really helps!

Now if you care about fashion in-game...
-The costumes are really cool, cute, pretty, beautiful... you name it!

---

Cons:
-Rude players in PvP.
-Stamina goes down during week days. (Ulimited stamina on weekends)
-Overpricing in the Market. (Compared to Elsword KR)

---

In my opinion, Elsword is the best dungeon crawler I've played yet. I've gotten multiple Tumblr friends into Elsword and they don't usually play games like MMOs! I play it everyday and nothing else! I really do reccomend you give this a try! It's the first game I've encountered with extremely nice GMs that hang around in Ruben sometimes! Go ahead and try it out, you won't regret it!

reviewText: Elsword is a side-scrolling arcade style beat-em-up, the game shines in the different classes and unlocking new ablities.  they recently made leveling ALOT easier and you can get your final job advancement (2nd one) in 3-4 days unless your playing on a saturday or sunday.  The reason i say this is because Elsword has a stamina system that goes down whenever you kill monsters in the fields, or when a monster dies in a dungeon.  Stamina is reset every night and all character's have seperate stamina bars, so if you run out of stamina on one character, just switch to another.  Also the maximum characters per account (without buying any) has increased from 3 to i believe 6.  A problem is that there is no character cuztomization if you dont spend real money, and the job advancement clothes they give you only last up to 2 weeks before getting deleted.  This makes some characters (like chung in my opinion) look really stupid, most others look fine though.  some events have given out costumes but these are rare.  The combat is nice and fluid as you can chain abilities with combos, and there are about 16 abilities per character but you can only have four of them on your skill bar, you can sawp them but they only give you enough SP (skill points) to max out around 6 so choose wisely (at each advancement you get a free potion that givs you back all your SP).  For i think 10 dollars you can unlock 4 extra abilit slots for one character,  but most abilities take 100 mana and your max is 300 so this is not essential to beat dungeons.  dungeons are easy early on but they get harder to beat later in the game, the way they do this is kind of wierd.  Good healing consumables have to be bought or can be crafted with materials you get in dungeons (either way works) but after level 40 it becomes a struggle to stay alive.  its works like this, there are around 30 to maybe 50 enimes per entire dungeon after level 40, my one character has around 100k hp but a single enemy hit can hit me 1k to possibly 10k depending on what it is so killing enemies efficiently and not getting hit is the name of the game.  life items can be found in boxes in the dungeons but these are used upon touching them are not abundent enough to sustain you through the entire game, on top of that the only way to get revives are though field bosses (rare to get revives from them), events, or buying them with real money.  its hard to explain but PvP's are decieded by whoever can chain more combos with abilities without knocking down the opponent (this sorta goes for PvE to but on a lesser scale), unless your in a 3v3 match and have team mates to interrupt the combo (start playing the game and it will make more sense).  i have friends who i play with so i dont interact with the community that much but guilds are the way to go to socialize as dungeons are usually too crazy with all the fighting to type to each other.  last thing i would like to point out is any dungeon can be entered from anywhere and you can que for 4 player parties or just start instantly with whoever is in your party.  all in all the game has its cons but being a free to play game it is worth a try as they are adding new content on a fairly regualr bases. now if youll exscuse me my fingers hurt.

reviewText:
Cons:
-Game requires you to buy extra slots if you want to have a wide veriaty of inventory space, skills during dungeons, quick use items, and storage space (bank).

-The game is based around a sort of time limit of play per character wich is measured by the stamana bar at the bottom right of the screen. Granted if you play dungeons with other players, the bar decreases at a much slower rate. Once depleted you cannot access dungeons, but you can still go around in the hub world and grind at the fields against generic enemies and the occasional field boss that appears about every 10-20 min if people in the feild are defeating the generic enemies.

-Outfits....you can forget about full custimization freedom, most of the awesome stuff is in the store (as in IRL cash). Lvling up after lvl 34 starts to drag so be ready to take on side quests or grind at the fields.

-Lastly, you will be given a quest to change job class when you reach the appropiate lvl. this isnt usually a problem, but the tick is that when you take on the second job class you will be asked to obtain a certain amount of an item that, from what ive seen, has a drop rate of about 5-8%. Depending on the character and job class path taken, you will be asked to find an item in the varrying amounts of 10-100 (research your character if you have the time and want to put in the effort for them).

Pros:

-Anime style 2d beatem up that can provide hours of enjoyment. Sure the cons may look bad, but ive had this game for two years and recently linked it with steam.

-While you dont have full customization freedom, you have the oppertunity to find armor that looks different and cooler compared to the generic drops. They are harder to get, but get the full set and you will look cool AND get stat bonuses.

-Events are frequent and sometimes give you the option of obtaining and keeping an item that will be available only within that time period. first you obtain a temperary version then engage event quests to make the item permanent. Keep an eye on the news page as this will alert you to anything of the sort and go for it as soon as you see an event like so. Usually if an event goes on and offers an outfit or costume of some type with the added oppertunity to make it permanent, it will require you to complete and event quest nearly the entire month/week/etc in order to obtain the sufficiant quest rewards to do so, but in the end its worth it, because you didnt pay a thing.

-while it costs IRL money to obtain expansion to your inventory and of the like, you will not need it. What you have is enough unless you are a horder, in which case you may need some help.

-P2W (Pay-to-Win)? Nope. While you can buy items in the shop, you can obtain gear just as equal or better through your hard work. Accessory drops are also available in most dungeons (at an unbeliveable drop rate for some) that will give you stats boosts and give your character some added cosmetic look.

reviewText:
There's only really one thing to say about this game: It's very fast-paced. Unlike the automatic hack-and-slash of some side-scrolling MMORPG's, Elsword requires you to manually press the buttons and connect the attacks yourself. At the beginning, it might be boring and uneventful, but as you progress through the levels, the dungeons and the towns...you'll find that things do get a 'little' harder. And while you may have to grind more and more to get to the next level, it's worth it. WORTH. You know why?

The PVP.

The PVP in this damn game is phenomenal, and it's what hooked me into Elsword in the first place. Yes, it might seem easy in first glance, but experiencing it for yourself brings you to a whole new world. It's fresh. Exciting. Exhilarating. And most of all...it's addicting. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm not kidding when I say: Prepare your ♥♥♥♥, here comes the butthurt-whenever you step into Arena 1v1 and 3v3, or sparring. It's not easy. Not at all. It's hard, and it will test you and keep pushing you beyond your limits. It pushed me beyond my limits. Consistently. Just when I thought I couldn't get any better, I did. It's so competitive yet strangely casual at the same time that it's surreal. Honestly, for me, the reason that I keep coming back to Elsword despite the grinding and the fact that things do get a little repetitive, is the PVP.

So what are you waiting for? Download it now! Even if you might not like it, just keep it and PVP once in a while to feel adrenaline pumping throughout your veins. There's nothing like it.

reviewText:
To start off, let's do a quick summary of what Elsword is:
Elsword is a Anime Styled, Side Scrolling, Free to Play, Class-based RPG Fighter in which you are given the choice of 9 different characters to fight with, level up and evolve" so to say. Each character has different skill trees which can be chosen to fit your personal gameplay style.
Like to play as a Free Knight and acquire pyromancer abilities? Choose Elesis! Like being a Tank for your team? Choose Chung! How about being an Archer to attack from long range? Choose Rena!

This selection of characters is great for all kinds of players and helps broaden the audience for this game. It has typical elements which you can expect from an RPG: Armour
hoursPlayed: grinding etc. These elements fit well into the world of Elsword
voteText: helping you defeat bosses in dungeons to earn XP and gain better armour and weapons!\n\nSpeaking of bosses
helpfulPercent: there may be repetition with such bosses as Banthus but besides that
votesHelpful: they are both challenging and rewarding. The game itself seems to get very addicting when you are trying to level up your character and get them to their next form or "evolution" as I've said before. The stamina bar is used to prevent addiction. This bar is gradually used up as you complete dungeons and once you are out of stamina you cannot do any more dungeons for the day. Stamina is refilled every day though as well as having unlimited stamina at weekends so all you fanatics can play to your hearts content.\n\nIn closing
votesTotal: I believe Elsword is a fun
votesFunny: vibrant and addicting game and I recommend it to all of you anime or RPG lovers."

reviewText:
Simply horrid. It's essentially a game that functions much like Dungeon Fighter: Online (DFO) and other old school beat'em ups except with the 3d twist. Although you can choose between controller and keyboard, every prompt will be chosen in keyboard fashion resulting in you being forced into using the keyboard option.
This MMO is the epitome of what F2P MMOs have become in this day and age from the copy-pasted HUD to the terrible graphics that were created in (probably) Blender.
The combat is stale and uninspiring and in the first level of the game I found myself doing over two thousand damage, showing how bad the damage inflation already is. I can only imagine doing hundreds of thousands of damage at a later part of the game despite the amount of damage being negligible as long as it's the same percent damage (i.e. they could scale it to far lower numbers but because they didn't do so, it shows that they care very little for game balance and that it will only worsen over time) Also the quests, inventory, and dungeon system are all quite confusing and the party I played the game with wanted to puke all over themselves after only five minutes of handling the UI.
There is absolutely no customibility in the game besides the skill tree
PvP evidently exists in the game, but man... when they can't even do PvE how could I trust a company to do PvP?

My final words would have to be, DO NOT PLAY THIS.
Also we need to get around to e-mailing Nexon to get DFO back. It was a really good game if you could get over how god-awful Nexon servers were. Maybe I should mail Gabe too.

reviewText: A great decent game... one of the best side-scrolling games i've evered played, but the economy. When i played during the summer the rare and good iceburner top and bottom peices would go up for an average amount from 100-500mil, the gloves and shoes would only be 10-130 million in game currency. But when I checked back after the new expansion for the new character Ara, the iceburner peices for her were way too expensive for a average person. One pair of gloves can go up to 400mil-700mil, top and bottom peices can go up to 1 BILLION!! That's insanely a crazy amount of in game currency. OF COURSE by just playing the game and finishing the dungeons will not give you that crazy amount of ED(in game currency). How do people buy those peices? Goldbuying isn't allowed in this game like all other mmorpgs. So they buy k-ching" real money currency and sell them ingame to get those ED. However
date: you can always choose to use your kching and open boxes and have a 5% of chance getting those peices. If it weren't for the economy right now to ruin this game
recommended: this game is one of the best sidescrolling games if you play with your friends. It's very fun and it will keep you updated. If your a player who doesn't care about character stats

reviewText:
There's only really one thing to say about this game: It's very fast-paced. Unlike the automatic hack-and-slash of some side-scrolling MMORPG's, Elsword requires you to manually press the buttons and connect the attacks yourself. At the beginning, it might be boring and uneventful, but as you progress through the levels, the dungeons and the towns...you'll find that things do get a 'little' harder. And while you may have to grind more and more to get to the next level, it's worth it. WORTH. You know why?

The PVP.

The PVP in this damn game is phenomenal, and it's what hooked me into Elsword in the first place. Yes, it might seem easy in first glance, but experiencing it for yourself brings you to a whole new world. It's fresh. Exciting. Exhilarating. And most of all...it's addicting. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm not kidding when I say: Prepare your ♥♥♥♥, here comes the butthurt-whenever you step into Arena 1v1 and 3v3, or sparring. It's not easy. Not at all. It's hard, and it will test you and keep pushing you beyond your limits. It pushed me beyond my limits. Consistently. Just when I thought I couldn't get any better, I did. It's so competitive yet strangely casual at the same time that it's surreal. Honestly, for me, the reason that I keep coming back to Elsword despite the grinding and the fact that things do get a little repetitive, is the PVP.

So what are you waiting for? Download it now! Even if you might not like it, just keep it and PVP once in a while to feel adrenaline pumping throughout your veins. There's nothing like it.

reviewText:
To start off, let's do a quick summary of what Elsword is:
Elsword is a Anime Styled, Side Scrolling, Free to Play, Class-based RPG Fighter in which you are given the choice of 9 different characters to fight with, level up and evolve" so to say. Each character has different skill trees which can be chosen to fit your personal gameplay style.
Like to play as a Free Knight and acquire pyromancer abilities? Choose Elesis! Like being a Tank for your team? Choose Chung! How about being an Archer to attack from long range? Choose Rena!

This selection of characters is great for all kinds of players and helps broaden the audience for this game. It has typical elements which you can expect from an RPG: Armour
hoursPlayed: grinding etc. These elements fit well into the world of Elsword
voteText: helping you defeat bosses in dungeons to earn XP and gain better armour and weapons!\n\nSpeaking of bosses
helpfulPercent: there may be repetition with such bosses as Banthus but besides that
votesHelpful: they are both challenging and rewarding. The game itself seems to get very addicting when you are trying to level up your character and get them to their next form or "evolution" as I've said before. The stamina bar is used to prevent addiction. This bar is gradually used up as you complete dungeons and once you are out of stamina you cannot do any more dungeons for the day. Stamina is refilled every day though as well as having unlimited stamina at weekends so all you fanatics can play to your hearts content.\n\nIn closing
votesTotal: I believe Elsword is a fun
votesFunny: vibrant and addicting game and I recommend it to all of you anime or RPG lovers."

reviewText:
Simply horrid. It's essentially a game that functions much like Dungeon Fighter: Online (DFO) and other old school beat'em ups except with the 3d twist. Although you can choose between controller and keyboard, every prompt will be chosen in keyboard fashion resulting in you being forced into using the keyboard option.
This MMO is the epitome of what F2P MMOs have become in this day and age from the copy-pasted HUD to the terrible graphics that were created in (probably) Blender.
The combat is stale and uninspiring and in the first level of the game I found myself doing over two thousand damage, showing how bad the damage inflation already is. I can only imagine doing hundreds of thousands of damage at a later part of the game despite the amount of damage being negligible as long as it's the same percent damage (i.e. they could scale it to far lower numbers but because they didn't do so, it shows that they care very little for game balance and that it will only worsen over time) Also the quests, inventory, and dungeon system are all quite confusing and the party I played the game with wanted to puke all over themselves after only five minutes of handling the UI.
There is absolutely no customibility in the game besides the skill tree
PvP evidently exists in the game, but man... when they can't even do PvE how could I trust a company to do PvP?

My final words would have to be, DO NOT PLAY THIS.
Also we need to get around to e-mailing Nexon to get DFO back. It was a really good game if you could get over how god-awful Nexon servers were. Maybe I should mail Gabe too.

reviewText: Elsword is indeed very repetative with many dungeons and quest that can often cause thge player to have frustraitions while playing the game. That however should be no reason to not try this game. Besides being repetative Elsword has plenty of features in game to make the game more fun and also entertaining. One Feature is character customization. The game has many In-Game shops where you can buy accessories and diffrent types of armor for your character. If thats not not enough the game also has a cash shop where you can buy many kinds of costumes  and items that give you mounts and many peices of gear that helps you make many diffrent character customizations. Another two features is pvp and the skill tree. Elsword has a solid base for pvp that allows you to create your own combinations of combos that can knock your opponent down with lightning ast attks to attking your enemy while their in the air with swift skills or slashes from the characters blade. with many skills and combinations to chose from the pvp has a uniqueness of its own. For players that want to get married in game there is a marriage system. The marriage sytem is broken into 4 steps. first you need to find the person you want your character to marry. afterwards you need to buy the couples ring from the cash shop (The item can only be found in the CashShop alone).once you give the ring to the person you want to marry you must wait 3 days (this time can be used to get to know eachother better ). when the time is up you can buy the marriage pakage which will have a certain number of invatations you can send to your friends and a item for using one of the chappels in the game. The final feature i'm going to be speaking of is the world aspect of the game since with all due respect i don't want to waste any more of peoples time.the world aspect may be that it is a side-scroller game but that doesn't mean it doesn't have anything for you to do. this multiplayer game will have you in a single player instance to start with in the beginning but there is more to it. after that one instance you are sent into the open world. you can meet many people, make friends, even for you people that struggle with the dungeons or quest there is a large community of people to help you get through the game.

reviewText:
You need to play it yourself to see what it's all about, and when something is free, give me one excuse why you shouldn't at least give it a shot.

A great MMO and a great Beat-em' Up merged into one neat title which can be a little heavy on your wallet at times but is still an overall great experience. At the time of writing I've put 100+ hours into 3 characters, and it was mostly worth it. A few frustrations keep this from being a 10/10 game but it's certainly worthy of at least an 8.

Great combat mechanics, fun combos, good anime-style visuals, passable story. lots of variety and lots of fun and laughs. Highly recommend.

reviewText:
This game is great for those who love dungeon crawlers. It's addicting and with Ara's Little Devil released to the NA server, the game just got better. Each character has their own ability and really neat weapon. My all time favorite has to be Chung's Deadly Chaser class. He's great in PvP since he's great for ranged and close-up combat with his cannon, Destroyer.

---

Pros:
-Excellent gameplay!
-Friendly GMs~ (You go, GMs Cuddles and Pebbles!)
-Neat events!
-An Awesome community that really helps!

Now if you care about fashion in-game...
-The costumes are really cool, cute, pretty, beautiful... you name it!

---

Cons:
-Rude players in PvP.
-Stamina goes down during week days. (Ulimited stamina on weekends)
-Overpricing in the Market. (Compared to Elsword KR)

---

In my opinion, Elsword is the best dungeon crawler I've played yet. I've gotten multiple Tumblr friends into Elsword and they don't usually play games like MMOs! I play it everyday and nothing else! I really do reccomend you give this a try! It's the first game I've encountered with extremely nice GMs that hang around in Ruben sometimes! Go ahead and try it out, you won't regret it!

This game at the beginning was very fun but quickly as I rose through the ranks and levels it just became so repetative. Even though they have fixed a lot of the problems with the game the cons outway the pros by a land slide. PvP isnt fun whatsoever. For me I would always be put against someone 30 Levels higher than me and or someone who hasnt even played the game. Don't even get me started on the amount of spotty connections you have. This game in general just is a massive decline. Those willing to pay are given a giant advantage over people who dont pay and it just isnt fair. This is seen even in dungeon mode when people have mounts and payed for costumes and gear, they wipe through the dungeon without letting you get a single hit. reviewText: It quite a simple game with alot of different character selection and weapons, the art is beautiful added along with the music that creates a great experiences all together. The game mostly revolve around doing quests and leveling up, along with a few side quest for pets or material. The battling in this game is kinda boring, since the trick is to go up and attack before the enemy hits you, but they added along with it many different attack moves varying from each class. One problem is that looking good in this game is costly, since 5 dollar gets you about 600/500 credit in the game and a even a shoe cost 200 so if the developers would lower the cost a bit the game would be prefect.The game does alot of speaicl events and offers for the player, like giveaways, 2x drops, etc. In the game you are able to get marry and create guilds (with real money) and certain other things.Overall, it's a great game and I would recommend this to anybody who enjoy mmos and anime.

reviewText: Well, for starting, I hate to see all that players out there that are spamming bad reviews. Elsword is a good game, it has a good concept of ARPG. It has a nice cashshop, and that doesn't mean It's P2W, it's completely F2P, you can have a nice gaming experience with Elsword without spending a penny. It has an incredible array of character customization. This game brings fresh air, it has a good combo system which allows you to do cool combos. For that RPG lovers, it has a interesting backstory. Finally, it's always filled with events. 9/10

reviewText:
I know, most of the reviews of this game are currently negative, but I've been honestly playing this game while it was on Steam Greenlight, and even though there's been a few things that have been rocky, Elsword has been a game that has it's perks.

Sure, the North American community can be jerks, but the game is meant to be played with friends and others. Multiplayer in this game is great, and it's something I can see nothing wrong with it.

The game has a large cast of characters (soon to be 10), so you can always go back and try that one out, each with their own job paths, which add to the possibilites.

So, this game might not be your cup of tea, but personally, this game is entertained me for years, and continues to even today.

reviewText:
Elsword is an awesome game.

But why i do not recomend this game?
Elsword is broken, it is a fact.

And the Developer (KOG games) just seems to be obssesed with pleasing themself (and their wallet), lets break it down then.

Every new character, the developer has stated that they intentionally overpower this new character, making it a biased game everytime a character is released, then nerf it a little and continue with the cycle.

Nerfs are nice now and again, but they do not listen a single suggestion the community has given, reason why overpowered characters remain overpowered even after nerf.

Equipment, any game that rely on equipment on PvP is bound to be pay to win, people may say it is not, but tell them if  a +10 weapon will not win a +7 weapon? The boost from +9  to +10 is just too significant.

Lag, oh lord, save me here. This game is infested with it and it means so much while in PvP, does not matter how fast or good you are, you lag or the enemy lag, it turns the table way to significantly, this will not be fixed because of how the game is developed (Peer to peer)

For an old game it is odd how high the prices are in the cash shop.

Elsword is pretty much the Perfect World of action/2D genre, that pretty much sums it up.

reviewText: I love Elsword, but it just got so grindy, I'm not the type of guy that can spend like half a year trying to get a certain set without having to waste so much ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ money. But then I discovered Void Elsword. If you're like me... Go over to Void Elsword, KR Exp table, cheaper prices on literally everything including Void's version of K-Ching. Also unlimited stamina, all you gotta do is buy the potions which are only 1k each. I know I don't have many hours on steam Elsword, that's because I played Elsword before I got a steam account. I should have about 200 hours on it tho. I just liked remaking characters and then stopping at 40. In Void I can get to 70 no problem, and in my opinion, Void is much more enjoyable due to fact that the community is so much nicer and literally almost everyone gets along. BEWARE PVP! Since it is an international server... If you come across someone from a whole different country... Good luck my friend, good luck.

reviewText: In My Opinion This Game Is Pretty Fun. This Game Has Little Customization, Which Certainly Urks Me, But Makes Up For It In Terms Of Gameplay. This Game Is Basically A Beat-'Em-Up RPG, Which Arent Really Common, And Are Hard To Make Fun Or Enjoyable, But Elsword Pulls It Off. This Game Also Has A Pretty Cute Anime Art Style, Which Drew My Attentions Toward It Once I First Saw It. Definatlly A Fun Game For Defeating Enemies With Zany Combos Whilst Be In An Anime Art Style, Though It Does Lack A Bit In The Story Department.\n\nOverall, My Rating For This Would Be A 7/10, Being That It Is A Very Fun Beat-'Em-Up RPG With Zany Combos, That Is Pretty Casusal Gaming Wise, So It Isnt Too Intense At All. The Few Things That Get Me Is That It Has Little Story, Not Much Customization And Like Half The Stuff Given To You Will Expire In About a Week, Forcing You To Use It While You Can And Trying To Pull You Further Into This Game, Where We Dont Need It.

reviewText:
Ignore the hours on Steam, I recently switched.

Having played this game for years, I have had mixed emotions. When there is not a big event, like a character release (AKA LuCiel atm), or new secret dunges or revamps, this game is bad. The events suck, and it always feels P2W. But, I have had an enourmous ammount of fun with this game. I would recommend if you want to play for a little bit, and not grind seriously. If you like side scrolling beat-em-ups, and anime, then this game is for you. If not, then stay away. You will only enjoy events that have new releases or revamps, and the game may seem fun at first, but the novelty wears off. The economy sucks too. Like, you can't buy anything really. I have no REAL quarrel with the game, it's just that sometimes the developers don't seem to care (KoG) about the NA servers. IF you can, I would recommend the Korean servers. They get free thigns all the time, but it is a long and complicated process.

TL:DR This game is P2W, adn the events suck. Novelty wears off.

reviewText: Elsword is a good game but there are some things players should know before they get really involved in it like i had first off know that it can indeed be considered pay to win (go figure right? free to play = pay to win) however it isnt AS BAD as a lot of others just really..... really... OVERPRICED..... for starters the costumes (which for some reason cost around $20-25 for a full set) provide minor buffs to your stats.. now end game this stuff becomes a pretty large help.. then lets talk about accessories they also provide buffs (however these are just as expensive if not more then the actual outfit overall were talking a good.. ehhhh $50-60 to outfit your character properly mind you that isnt even including things like mounts which range up to like $40-50 depending on your mount some are low in the $20s also isnt including the fact they cut all your storages in half and if you want the other portion you have to pay along with your item bar is cut in half too so that you have to pay for and the list goes on) and then theres the 2nd skill bar which costs $10 per character.. overall the game is a very large cash grab and while playable players who can throw money at there screen can definitly have a much more enjoyable, faster, and stronger experience plus they just look better.. now you think well thats fine one character only $80 thats fine i can do that.. keep in mind though thats PER CHARACTER and theres alot of classes PER CHARACTER your going to be tempted into other classes which is just going to slowly rack up that amount of money you spend. The community is chock-full of ages that are usually between 8-14 (thats a average not everybody) in which can get on your nerves severely when they start whining at you especially when it comes to things like pvp.. now onto the game mechanics.. while the game is indeed a cash grab from hell and full of squeakers the gameplay is actually pretty superb for this kind of gamestyle depending on your character and class will depend on a lot of combos you can learn and then execute in pvp sounds great right? it is great however this game suffers from time to time LAG when it comes to pvp even with the most godly of connections the servers can suddenly start going unstable (for unknown reasons probably from just sheer amount of players at one time or DDOS whatever the case may be lag is lag and can completely alter a match or even knock you out of a ranked game which yes WILL penalize you but not by much because the ranked system caters to the player making it very easy to keep rank less you are a SSS in which things are more complicated.. the higher the rank you go the more TOXIC the community actually becomes and alot of times just during your PVE runs you will get people who appear afk but infact are just standing around making YOU do the work and when the next area is ready that player will then move to make you go forward.. the only actual good quality to this game is indeed the combat but with the pay to win scale the random lag and toxic squeakers i cant actually recommend this game the game is enjoyable but you will indeed notice alot of things concerning pay to win that makes things alot less enjoyable for you...

reviewText:
Honestly the concept has promise but between the NA publisher's increasing drive to get people to cash, and the general incompetence (class balance, updates screwing things up, etc), I really must say: Turn back now. (I've since stopped playing)

Some Pluses:
the exp rates are reasonable now (surprisingly)
PvE Community is tolerant of Underpowered classes.
The game itself is pretty fun (before you hit stat bloatville known as Sander)

Negatives
Community is insanely greedy (even worse than before with people tradining large amounts of KChing for stuff)
The publisher does do nothing towards keeping the economy in line
PvP community is quick to make hacking accusations
In game events tend to be bleh if not frustrating
Things are generally much worse/cash heavy compare to KR (99% of skill notes are now cash shop only)
Wonky class imbalance (not as bad as Marvel vs Capcom 2 but the OP and UP classes are pretty obvious)
And for those that are interested in its beat'em up mechanics: KoG is pushing the game towards being a maple story clone and the game's design basically punishes some classes.

Again I can only recommend not playing this. Play Castle Crashers instead for example or wait until DFOG beta begins.

reviewText: The game itself is very well built, its hard to come by a n ice sidescroller game with so many options with skill trees, job classes, and other things that are so small but make such a huge difference. Biggest problem for me is the fact that if you want to win in this game, you need to donate, the game is fun casual play, but as for wanting to get better, its all in how much you pay to win, skill only takes you so far in it. The community itself has gone very downhil since the game started as well, now its full of trolls and people with giant egos thanks to how much they've spent on it. Reason why I make I recommend it is if you can look past the pvp and dungeon things, it has some nice events to help you reach max level, some challenging dungeons and you dont /need/ to party with strangers. Its great to play with friends, as for trying to playing play it competitively, unless you're willing to spend a ton of cash, I wouldn't recommend it.
